page.title: 11DOWNLAND:BROOK DOWNS
page.content: {BROOK DOWNS}are part of a line of chalk which extends across the whole of the{ISLE OF WIGHT}from east to west.The downs are used extensively by walkers as the views are superb. On the western side of this downland is the local golf course which also attracts visters to the area. The downland is very rich in wildlife and plantlife.Varieties of plants seen include: speedwell,vetch,dog rose,red and white clover,purple orchids,gorse,lady's bedstraw,birdsfoot trefoil and hawksbeard. Wildlife is also abundant with rabbits and foxes.A kestrel was also seen flying overhead. The whole area is very picturesque.
